005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
009
010import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
012
013public interface INamedModelInstance extends IModelInstance, INamedInstance {
014  @Override
015  @NonNull
016  IModelDefinition getDefinition();
017
018  /**
019   * Indicates if a flag's value can be used as a property name in the containing
020   * object in JSON who's value will be the object containing the flag. In such
021   * cases, the flag will not appear in the object. This is only allowed if the
022   * flag is required, as determined by a {@code true} result from
023   * {@link IFlagInstance#isRequired()}. The {@link IFlagInstance} can be
024   * retrieved using {@link #getEffectiveJsonKey()}.
025   *
026   * @return {@code true} if the flag's value can be used as a property name, or
027   *         {@code false} otherwise
028   * @see #getEffectiveJsonKey()
029   */
030  // TODO: remove once moved to the instance side
031  default boolean hasJsonKey() {
032    return getEffectiveJsonKey() != null;
033  }
034
035  /**
036   * Get the JSON key flag instance for this model instance, if one is configured.
037   *
038   * @return the JSON key flag instance or {@code null} if a JSON key is
039   *         configured
040   */
041  @Nullable
042  IFlagInstance getEffectiveJsonKey();
043
044  /**
045   * Get the JSON key associated with this instance.
046   *
047   * @return the configured JSON key or {@code null} if no JSON key is configured
048   */
049  @Nullable
050  IFlagInstance getJsonKey();
051
052  @Override
053  default QName getReferencedDefinitionQName() {
054    return getContainingModule().toModelQName(getName());
055  }
056
057  @Override
058  default QName getXmlQName() {
059    return getContainingModule().toModelQName(getEffectiveName());
060  }
061}
